title: why not create more layers of language filtering..?
body:
Recently had ONE bad game where i said some pretty fucked up things, i'll admit i shouldn't of said and I won't bother posting chatlog,  But finding the bad things I said and using that as a reason to 14-day ban me even though people reported me in normals simply because I wasn't paying attention and bought relic shield on the wrong champ and realized it too late is wrong. So I started thinking, why not let players decide their own experience instead of language/thought policing everything. Why not let players choose between "heavy chat filtration, casual chat filter, no chat filter (except buzzwords like "kys and %%%" because apparently they get through chat filter still, because I'd like to assume that the people who are ACTUALLY getting upset over the things people say are still immature and playing with the filter on..), and vulgar where people can freely say what they want and hear EVERYTHING freely without getting bAnNeD for saying mean things.

And before you people put on your "_I'm a proper high elo player_" hats and snack on your _caviar_, its not about "promoting this type of behavior," people are going to do what they want and say what they want, you cannot control human nature and sometimes it gets nasty. I'm not saying I agree with the toxic community, but I'm saying why not just let people speak freely if they so **_choose_** instead of banning everybody or punishing players, trying to create a "safe space?" why not let players CHOOSE to create their own safe space if they're so unstable/immature that they need one. Why not permaban "%%%got, %%%, retard, kys, kill yourself" from every filtration level if you're just gonna ban/punish people for saying it? Seems almost like you're putting the cookie jar at child height then waiting to smack them if they try to touch it.

TL;DR
Add new options so people can make their own safespace and be protected from "triggerwords" instead of banning people who offend these mentally unstable grown children, or permaban these trigger words so players dont slip up and get punished hard for losing their cool.

you're a video game company riot, not college campus thought police. Find ways to keep players having fun, not dividing and punishing people to keep offended people safe and enclosed in bubble wrap.{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

replies.body:
> ...even though people reported me in normals...

The rules apply to all gamemodes. It doesn't matter if you're in a Normal, a Ranked match, or bots, you are expected to follow the rules.

---

Addressing your proposal - there's no need for extra layers to the Mature Language Filter, as far as I can tell. Players already can decide the experience they want by selecting their Language Filter options, and reporting people who they think are contributing to a negative experience of the game. If the IFS agrees, then the player who got reported gets punished.

And this argument here;

> ...you cannot control human nature and sometimes it gets nasty.

Is just plain weak. "Human nature" is absolutely controllable. If it wasn't, civilization as a _whole_ wouldn't exist, because the "human nature" you're trying to argue with is vile, vitriolic, and unnecessary.

You were clearly punished for zero-tolerance chat, and you're arguing that Riot's trying to "create a safe-space" - and yet, here you are, asking for a safe-space of your own, where you can be handheld and kept away from the repercussions of your own misbehavior.

Rather than expect Riot to bend the rules or make the game bend to the rules to cater to even the toxic player's wants and needs, how about we expect the players to actually obey the rules that Riot set out, and not make excuses when they get punished for breaking them?

No, it's people. The game doesn't bark insults at others or lay into them for mistakes, it doesn't shout obscenities whenever things don't go its' way, and it sure as shit doesn't use hate speech or tell others to harm or kill themselves.

If you're just going to make absurd, pointless claims like "the game is toxic, not people" or "human nature can't be controlled", then there's no meaningful discussion to be had here.

It's the culture however positive or good Riot intended for it to be -- it's actually very negative.

And they're working on improving it - whether it's through negative reinforcements like punishments, warnings, and account bans, or positive reinforcements, like Honor incentives.

Adding arbitrary levels of Mature Language filtering and generally enabling toxicity isn't going to help make the community any less negative, though, so ultimately, the proposal from the main post is unhelpful in regards to working to better the League community.

I simply disagree, it's not adding "arbitrary levels of mature language filter," and its not "enabling toxicity," nobody wants to enable toxicity. I'm simply offering a suggestion that would keep riot from banning players who have spent money on this game because they said somebodies triggerword in more than one match.

Here's the thing - when it comes to zero-tolerance chat, it's stuff you should _already know **not** to say._ If you still choose to say it, the repercussions are yours to take.

Beyond that, adding in the extra Mature Language filtering would not reduce the amount of people getting punished for breaking the rules. Just because you don't know what word they used doesn't mean you don't know what they're using it for - to insult and flame.

So, at the end of the day, people would still get punished for flame. More levels of mature language filtering would not change that. Beyond that, I don't know anyone who even uses the Mature Language filter as-is, so, what good would it do to change something that (as far as anyone knows) nobody uses?

Rather than expect other people to go through and manually filter out certain words, how's about we expect people to just obey the rules and not flame or use hate speech? It'd be a hell of a lot easier to minimize punishments if people just followed the rules they agreed to when signing up.

Just chiming in about the knowing what is Zero Tolerance and what isn't. Recently have been seeing/learning new ones never would have even guessed.

Course if someone in game tries to go "say my name twice or I'll feed." then that would raise a red flag.

Riot permanently closes the account because they want the player to go elsewhere. They realistically can't prevent a player from creating another account due to the nature of it being a F2P game, so the most that they can do is ban the player's account (with all their progress and skins) and force them to start from scratch should they want to continue playing league.

Do you have a better suggestion on how Riot is to encourage them to leave?

Other F2P games have better ban policies, and keep trash out.

Hardware and IP bans exist and are much more inconvenient.

Curious how you would do a hardware ban and an ip ban is worthless for two reasons; 1. It isn't hard to change ip. 2. It affects whole dorms/cafes/households. Which means innocent players lose the ability to play until they change the ip (which again is simple)

> it isnt hard to change ip

"Well, they're gonna smuggle drugs in anyway, why not just retire US Customs"

Good. 
Before they change the IP they can punish the customer responsible for copping the ban and inconveniencing them.

>"Well, they're gonna smuggle drugs in anyway, why not just retire US Customs"

More like "Well, since anybody with half a brain can 100% foolproof escape our border controls, and since some people literally just have to restart their car (or wait long enough) to not only get rid of the punishment, but also divert punsihment to actual innocents, it might just be best to completely scrap US Customs, given that they are pretty much 0% effective and might harm innocents."

I mean, seriously, how do you deal with dynamic IP addresses? People who have **absolutely** nothing to do with the person that was banned, could end up getting the same IP. And those who get punished literally just have to turn off their router and restart it.
Hell, due to 24-hour disconnects, some people literally don't even have to know anything about how the internet works, and yet will succesfully circumvent any applied IP ban in at most 24 hours.

Smuggling in stuff is a lot more difficult than changing an ip which basically involves unplugging a router for 10 seconds. Then somebody else gets the banned IP.

Yup, let me easily identify out of 20 people playing in one location the single person responsible for this entire problem.

no? not at all, what im saying is if players are offended by certain buzzwords then they should be able to change their chat filter accordingly so people don't have to limit what they say as though they don't have freedom of speech. At the very least let people have their own list of buzzwords that will automatically be censored OR just automatically censor these "trigger words" instead of giving people the freedom to say them, then punish them for it. Im not crying over my punishment, I'm simply trying to offer an alternative to "just ban everybody who offends me"

I don't think that'd work; unless the player base were full of idiots, most everyone would be able to derive what's being said through context. More to the point, I shouldn't have to put in extra work so that the game's enjoyable to me.

Not being able to see the trash crying does not make the trash go away or not ruin a game.

The mute option already exists for when nobody wants to see some worthless trash, but it does not solve the problem. Why would making the chat filter even more aggressive (everyone turns it off for a reason) help?

Riot will still take out the trash, because nobody needs to have little brats running their mouths while they run down lane and throw the game to 'punish' people for not doing what they want.

My problem with this game is deliberate saboteurs. I go into every single game with a positive mindset, I respect my teammates, I go into every game looking for the W. I keep my composer throughout the entire game as well as far as performance, even when I am behind I play accordingly.

It irks the hell out of me when people come into those games just to make your team lose. It happens A LOT. Especially in low elo. Unfortunately I placed low silver this year in my placements and I hate it here, but when those dumb asses join I always let them have it, and I don't care about the punishments. The honor system is stupid anyway even when I maintain positive levels the rewards just aren't that great. The most toxic aspect of this game are players that sabotage games intentionally.

The culture of snowflakes needs to go away and something more needs to be done about saboteurs. Being a whinny snowflake and playing a competitive game simply does NOT mix.

I don't get why Riot bans hate speech when they could just make a fucking filter so you can't use hate speech in the first place. Some people have mental issues and they can't stop themselves from being toxic.
